markdownRemark.html:
How to add new people to Github

  1. Send an email to Bob Henrikson (robert.henrikson@va.gov) (also @bobrox1973 on Github)
  2. Include new person email address or Github user handle
  3. Include what team they are being added. Please see example below:
  4. The following individual [insert email or Github username] needs be added to this team [insert team. e.g., Ad Hoc-general]
  5. Please expect your request/issue to be closed within 24hrs.

Note: New person needs to set-up Two-Factor authentication (2FA). This is enforced by Github. If someone doesn't set up 2FA, they risk be removed from the organization.

How to request adding new repositories

  1. Send an email to Bob Henrikson (robert.henrikson@va.gov) (also @bobrox1973 on Github)
  2. Include the following details in your email:
  3. What is the purpose/need of this repo?
  4. What is the repo name? lowercase, no spaces ie. lowercase-no-spaces
  5. Is it a public or private? (see below for repo best practices)
  6. What teams should be added to this repo?
  7. What are the permission settings for each team (read, write)?
  8. What is your personal GitHub user handle?

Best practices for repo:

  • Public:

    • This should be the default option for repositories in the Department of Veterans Affairs Github organization.
    • These repositories should have an appropriate open source license associated with them, but this is not up to the Github administrators to enforce / require it is just a best practice.

  • Private:

    • This should be used for code that not able to be released and made open source.
    • This can be used for a documentation repository.
    • This can be used for a planning / issue tracking purposes.

  • Things that should not be checked into version control no matter if they are public or private

    • User credentials
    • Private keys
    • Production resource details (database IP addresses and connection strings,â€¦)
  • As a default, DSVA GH team should be set as "admin" for all new repos.
